Class GameCharacter

java.lang.Object
Card
GameCharacter
public class GameCharacter
extends Card
GameCharacter is a subclass of Card and represents a playable character in Murder Madness. They can move onto certain Squares and into Estates.
Author:
johnh

      public GameCharacter​(java.lang.String name)

  • Method Details

    • moveToSquare

      public void moveToSquare​(Square square)
      Moves the GameCharacter to a square. If it is an EstateSquare, make square null and set the estate instead.
      Parameters:
      square - Square to move to

    • setSquare

      public void setSquare​(Square square)
      Directly sets the GameCharacter's square. Used during guesses.
      Parameters:
      square - Square character is moved to

    • getSquare

      public Square getSquare()
      Returns the Square this character is on.
      Returns:
      current square

    • drawCharacter

      public void drawCharacter​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws character on the board by calling drawCharToken.
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics object

    • drawCharToken

      public void drawCharToken​(java.awt.Graphics g, int x, int y, int offset)
      Draws the character tokens on the board. Used by drawCharacter as well as drawEstateContents.
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics object
      x - x position
      y - y position
      offset - position offset
